questions.question_text: Can a Standard User Profile import members into a campaign?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is:

B. No.

Explanation:

A Standard User Profile in Salesforce does not have the ability to import members into a campaign. Importing campaign members requires either the Marketing User checkbox to be enabled on the user’s profile and sufficient permissions to manage campaigns.
 • Users must have the “Marketing User” feature enabled to import campaign members.
 • Additionally, they need permission to create, edit, and manage campaigns.

Without these permissions and the “Marketing User” setting, a user with the Standard User Profile cannot import members into a campaign.

With the Data Import Wizard, a designated marketing user can use a CSV (comma-separated values) file to import contacts, leads, or person accounts and track their responses at each stage of a campaign. So, it is false.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.campaigns_import.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: A
A. True

Explanation:

In Salesforce, the record owner can be either a user or a queue. The record owner has control over the record and typically has rights such as viewing, editing, sharing, and transferring the record, depending on their permissions.
 • Users: Individuals assigned ownership of the record.
 • Queues: For certain objects (like Leads, Cases, and custom objects), ownership can be assigned to a queue, allowing multiple users to work on the record.

Thus, the statement is True.

According to the article, queues can be record owner temporarily.
"Queues in Salesforce act like a user record; instead of a user being the record owner, the queue is the record owner while the record is pending someone to work on it. There are multiple parts that make up a Salesforce Queue: Queue members Queue email (optional) Record assignment rules Quick actions Who Can Join a Queue? (Queue Members)"
